required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy (MRS) Validation Study in Individuals With Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)
clinical_study.official_title: MRS Validation Study of Hepatic Triglyceride Content in Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)Subjects Pre- and Post-Prandial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see how effective the investigators' optimized magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) sequence in quantifying hepatic triglyceride content (HTGC) to enhance MRS as a diagnostic tool in non-alcohol fatty liver disease (NAFLD).

detailed_description.textblock: One way to gauge MRS as an effective diagnostic tool is by looking at the reproducibility of the liver fat measurements on subjects by calculating the coefficient of variation (CV). This study assesses the modified MRS sequence, using both breath holds and free breathing. The HTGC levels are measured twice in the same individuals on two independent events separated by 10 minutes. Subjects are then given a high fat, high carbohydrate meal of Pizza Hut pizza, Pepsi, and Oreo cookies. Two hours after eating the meal, the subjects return to the scanner and repeat all MRS scans.

primary_outcome.measure: The Reproducibility of the Hepatic Triglyceride Content Measurement by MRS.
primary_outcome.description: We compared three 1H-Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy sequences: A Standard Siemens sequence, and an optimized sequence with either breath-holds or free-breathing. Repeat scans were done with the subject briefly removed from and returned to the scanner between scans. The results given are coefficients of variation of the triglyceride signal divided by the water signal.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Hepatic Triglyceride Content Pre- and Post-prandial.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after a 12 hour fast and 2 hours post-prandial
secondary_outcome.description: We compared the intrahepatic triglyceride content in subjects after a 12 hour fast and 2 hours after eating a high fat, high carbohydrate meal. The measure reported here is for the pre and post prandial results given as the ratio of triglyceride signal to water signal. After showing its reliability, we chose to use the results from the optimized breath-hold sequence.

secondary_outcome.measure: T2 (Spin-spin Relaxation Time) Ratios of Triglyceride/Water
secondary_outcome.description: T2 (spin-spin relaxation time) ratios of triglyceride/water using optimized PRESS sequences

arm_group.description: Non-diabetic, obese with diagnosed NAFLD (HTGC greater or equal to 5.5%)
Non-diabetic, obese with no previous diagnosis of NAFLD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes
- Pregnant

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited through the Center for Human Nutrition (CHN) beginning in July, 2009. Many had previously been enrolled in other CHN studies. The final subject was tested in December, 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All enrolled subjects completed the study.

The results given are coefficients of variation of the triglyceride signal divided by the water signal.

outcome.title: The Hepatic Triglyceride Content Pre- and Post-prandial.
outcome.description: We compared the intrahepatic triglyceride content in subjects after a 12 hour fast and 2 hours after eating a high fat, high carbohydrate meal. The measure reported here is for the pre and post prandial results given as the ratio of triglyceride signal to water signal. After showing its reliability, we chose to use the results from the optimized breath-hold sequence.

group.description: Non-diabetic, obese with diagnosed NAFLD (hepatic triglyceride content (HTGC) greater or equal to 5.5%)

measure.title: The Hepatic Triglyceride Content Pre- and Post-prandial.
measure.description: We compared the intrahepatic triglyceride content in subjects after a 12 hour fast and 2 hours after eating a high fat, high carbohydrate meal. The measure reported here is for the pre and post prandial results given as the ratio of triglyceride signal to water signal. After showing its reliability, we chose to use the results from the optimized breath-hold sequence.

analysis.groups_desc: As there was no a priori reason for the level of IHTG to impact this measurement we compared the pre and post-prandial results for all subjects whose data were of sufficient quality (N=12). These results are comparing the two categories of fasting and post-prandial. Null hypothesis was that there would be no difference in IHTG before and after a high fat, high carbohydrate meal.
analysis.p_value_desc: a priori threshhold for significance was set at p<0.05.

outcome.title: T2 (Spin-spin Relaxation Time) Ratios of Triglyceride/Water
outcome.description: T2 (spin-spin relaxation time) ratios of triglyceride/water using optimized PRESS sequences

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: all subjects studied. This includes both lean and obese subjects with a range of intrahepatic triglyceride.

measure.title: T2 (Spin-spin Relaxation Time) Ratios of Triglyceride/Water
measure.description: T2 (spin-spin relaxation time) ratios of triglyceride/water using optimized PRESS sequences

analysis.groups_desc: null hypothesis was that the T2 ratio would not depend on level of intrahepatic triglyceride (IHTG) and would be equal for the low and medium IHTG categories.
analysis.p_value_desc: This p-value compares the low IHTG (<5%) subjects to those with medium levels of IHTG (5 - 10%). The a priori threshold for statistical significance was p<0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: null hypothesis was that the T2 ratio would not depend on level of intra-hepatic triglyceride (IHTG) and would be equal for the low (<5%) and high (>10%) IHTG categories.
analysis.p_value_desc: The a priori threshold for statistical significance was p<0.05.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis was that there would be no difference in T2 relaxation ratios for varying levels of intra-hepatic triglyceride (IHTG). Thus the medium (5 - 10%) and high (<10%) IHTG groups would not be statistically different with regard to average T2 ratio.
analysis.p_value_desc: The a priori threshold for statistical significance was set at p<0.05.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
